com.datasift.dropwizard.kafka.config

Class KafkaConsumerConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datasift.dropwizard.kafka.config.KafkaClientConfiguration
      • com.datasift.dropwizard.kafka.config.KafkaConsumerConfiguration

  • public class KafkaConsumerConfiguration
extends KafkaClientConfiguration
    Configuration for a KafkaConsumer.

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • group

        @NotEmpty
protected String group
        Consumer group the KafkaConsumer belongs to.

      • partitions

        @NotNull
protected Map<String,Integer> partitions
        Mapping of the number of partitions to consume from each topic.

        Topics not referenced will not be consumed from.

      • timeout

        protected Duration timeout
        Time the KafkaConsumer should wait to receive messages before timing out the stream.

        When a KafkaConsumer times out a stream, a ConsumerTimeoutException will be thrown by that streams' ConsumerIterator.

        See Also:
        ConsumerIterator.next()

      • receiveBufferSize

        @NotNull
protected Size receiveBufferSize
        Size of the client-side receive buffer.

      • fetchSize

        @NotNull
protected Size fetchSize
        Maximum size of a batch of messages to fetch in a single request.

        This dictates the maximum size of a message that may be received by the KafkaConsumer. Messages larger than this size will cause a kafka.common.InvalidMessageSizeException to be thrown during iteration of the stream.

        See Also:
        kafka.javaapi.message.ByteBufferMessageSet#iterator()

      • backOffIncrement

        @NotNull
protected Duration backOffIncrement
        Cumulative delay before polling a broker again when no data is returned.

        When fetching data from a broker, if there is no new data, there will be a delay before polling the broker again. This controls the duration of the delay by increasing it linearly, on each poll attempt.

      • queuedChunks

        @Min(value=0L)
protected int queuedChunks
        Maximum number of chunks to queue in internal buffers.

        The consumer internally buffers fetched messages in a set of queues, which are used to iterate the stream. This controls the size of these queues.

        Once a queue has been filled, it will block subsequent attempts to fill it until (some of) it has been iterated.

      • autoCommit

        protected boolean autoCommit
        Automatically commits the currently consumed offsets periodically.
        See Also:
        autoCommitInterval

      • autoCommitInterval

        @NotNull
protected Duration autoCommitInterval
        Frequency to automatically commit currently consumed offsets, if enabled.
        See Also:
        autoCommitInterval

      • rebalanceRetries

        @Min(value=0L)
protected int rebalanceRetries
        Maximum number of retries during a re-balance.
